long_description: Eigenvector centrality is a method to calculate the centrality (relative importance) of each node in a graph. Katz centrality, Bonacich centrality and Eigenvector centrality are supported in this function.

input_tables.name: vertices
input_tables.rDescription: The input table contains vertices in the graph.
input_tables.description: The input table contains vertices in the graph.

input_tables.name: edges
input_tables.rDescription: The input table contains edges in the graph.
input_tables.description: The input table contains edges in the graph.

argument_clauses.name: TargetKey
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the target key columns in the edges table. The number and data types of columns must correspond to those of vertex_key.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the target key columns in the edges table. The number and data types of columns must correspond to those of vertex_key.

argument_clauses.name: EdgeWeight
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the edges table column that contains the edge weights. The edge weights must be positive values. If you omit this argument, then the graph is unweighted.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the edges table column that contains the edge weights. The edge weights must be positive values. If you omit this argument, then the graph is unweighted.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: Family
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the centrality formula. The default value is 'eigenvector'. For descriptions of the centrality formulas
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the centrality formula. The default value is 'eigenvector'. For descriptions of the centrality formulas

argument_clauses.name: Alpha
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the alpha value for the Katz or Bonacich centrality formula. The default value is 0.85.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the alpha value for the Katz or Bonacich centrality formula. The default value is 0.85.

argument_clauses.name: Beta
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the beta value for the Katz or Bonacich centrality formula. The default value is 1 for Katz and 0 for Bonacich.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the beta value for the Katz or Bonacich centrality formula. The default value is 1 for Katz and 0 for Bonacich.

argument_clauses.name: Directed
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the graph is directed. The default value is 'true'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether the graph is directed. The default value is 'true'.

argument_clauses.name: MaxIterNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum number of iterations for the function. The default value is 20.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations for the function. The default value is 20.

argument_clauses.name: Threshold
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the threshold for convergence (the difference of between bk+1 and bk). The default value is 0.001.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the threshold for convergence (the difference of between bk+1 and bk). The default value is 0.001.
